summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed on September 16, 2013. It designates executors for his estate, outlines the payment of debts and taxes, and bequeaths all his property to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust'. It includes detailed powers granted to the executors and a 'no-contest' clause for beneficiaries.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's entire estate is bequeathed to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust', a trust created on September 16, 2013.
Epstein appointed Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and James E. Staley as the primary executors of his will, with David Mitchell named as a successor.
The will grants the executors extremely broad powers to manage, invest, sell, and litigate regarding the estate's assets without needing court approval.
The document contains a strict 'no-contest' clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or the associated trust.
The will was signed and notarized on September 16, 2013, with Erika A. Kellerhals serving as the notary public.
